qas.question: Who brought Christian missionaries to Hawaii?
What cause royal Hawaiian females to find themselves ugly?
What are some examples of how a noble person should look before Christians came?
What did westerners call the women of Hawaii?
When would white men marry the paler and thinner Hawaiian ladies?

answers.text: By the last half of the 19th century

qas.question: Where did Christian missionaries follow traders before the 1800s?
Who followed Christian missionaries to the Hawaiian Islands?
What positively impacted the level of regard Hawaiian royal women held for their own indigenous looks?
What was dark skin no longer considered a sign of nobility?
When did European women start marrying Hawaiian men?

context: During the 1800s Christian missionaries from Great Britain and the United States followed <a0_0><b6_0>traders<b6_0/><a0_0/> to <b5_0>the Hawaiian islands<b5_0/>. Long-termly, <a1_0>the <b7_0>Anglo-Saxon presence<b7_0/><a1_0/> negatively impacted the level of regard Hawaiian royal women held for their own indigenous looks. For <b8_0>centuries prior<b8_0/> the arrival of Christians, first nation Hawaiian aesthetics, such as <a2_0>dark skin and ample bodies<a2_0/>, had been considered signs of nobility. No matter how much they adapted their mannerisms to Western standard, some of the Anglo-Saxon missionaries were relentless in referring to the indigenous women as "<a3_0>Hawaiian squaws<a3_0/>." <a4_0>By the <b9_0>last half of the 19th century<b9_0/><a4_0/>, some Hawaiian women began marrying European men who found them exotic. The men, however, selected Hawaiian women who were thinner and paler in complexion.
